dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASON waits outside his elementary school, laying in the grass staring up at the clouds. In the distance, the scho door opens and Mason's MOM, Olivia, walks toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, love bug. You ready? He is quickly on his feet and they are walking toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.     Hey, guess what, Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured out where wasps come from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?    Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think it must be if you flick a rock into the air just right, it'll turn into a wasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dang...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how was your day at school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I had a good meeting with Miss Butler this time. I kinda liked her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... she said that you weren't turning in your homework assignments. And I told her, "I know he does them, 'cause I check them every night." She said she found a big chunk of them crumpled up at the bottom of your backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't ask for 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, baby, she doesn't have to. You're supposed to turn them in. And she said you're still staring out the window all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she said that you destroyed her pencil sharpener.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, she said that you crammed a bunch of rocks in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought if it could sharpen pencils, maybe we could sharpen rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stifling laugh) Well, what were you gonna do with a bunch of sharpened rocks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to make arrowheads for my rock collection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm. She glances back at him, with an understanding sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason rides his bike across the front yard and heads down the street. Soon he and his friend TOMMY are riding down the embankment of a large drainage ditch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason runs up, as Tommy is spray-painting a drawing on th concrete wall of the drainage ditch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, when's my turn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Tommy hands Mason the can of spray paint.     Mason begin spray-paint a letter on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) ...Maaason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!    Tommy!    Is Mason down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, tell him he has to come home for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason lays on the floor watching a cartoon. There's a knock at the door, and Mom comes out to answer It's TED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sweetie. Why aren't you ready? Hey, Mason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on, hurry up.      Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nine.     Let's go, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I meant to call you, 'cause Janice flaked out. I don't have a sitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you call somebody else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't get a baby-sitter now, it's nine o'clock. But you're welcome to hang out with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no. I mean we have plans. The guys are expecting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... you can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Yeah, well, I'll come back in a couple of hours. Is that okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids lie on either side of Mom, as she reads a story aloud to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reading) "Turn back! Turn back! I don't wanna talk to Moaning Myrtle." "Who?" said Harry as they backtracked quickly. "She haunts one of the toilets in the girls bathroom on the first floor," said Hermione. "She haunts a toilet?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Yes, it's been out of order all year because she keeps having tantrums and flooding the place." "I never went in there anyway if I could avoid it. It's awful trying to have a pee with her wailing at you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason lies awake in bed listening to his mother argue wit Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you just say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.   I don't want to go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sorry, that's bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, I wanna stay here with my kids. That's what I'd rather do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Would you stop using your kids as an excuse?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not using my kids as an excuse! You don't even know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you have to stay here with your kids! You're acting--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have this immature life--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why do I always-- Why--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an immature life!   I have an immature life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I have responsibilities, okay, you don't know what it's like to be a parent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't! And why am I responsible for your mistakes in life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you had any idea. You don't think I wouldn't--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason peeks around the corner to watch as the argument continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call my kids mistakes!   Don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not responsible for your life choic-- I didn't call your kids--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said, "Your respons-- your mistakes in your life," pointing at my kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I said, you know what, and immediately you use your kids again. Mason peeks through the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the reality: I'm a parent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's, that's hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're a parent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would love to have some time to myself! I would love to just go to a fuckin' movie! You don't think I'd like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go have some dinner, go to a bar! I don't even know what that's like. I was someone's daughter, then I was somebody's fucking mother! Okay, I don't know what that's like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason is comfortably asleep. Samantha slowly pulls the pi out from underneath his head and smacks him with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) "Oops, I did it again... I played with your heart. Got lost in the game. Oh baby, baby..." Mason throws a stuffed animal at her that she deflects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Oops, you think I'm in love. I'm sent from above. I'm not that innocent." Another stuffed animal.    She continues to sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Quit it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You see my problem is this. I'm dreaming away. Wishing that heroes truly exist. I cry watching the day. Can't you see I'm a fool in so many ways..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit!   Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "But to lose all my senses-- that is..." He tries to drown out this last bit with a sustained scre Soon the door flies open and Mom enters, angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on in here?! Samantha has instantaneously shifted from singing to cryi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you guys know what time it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through tears/sobs) He's throwing things at me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason! Do not throw things at your sister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's faking, she hit me first!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, both of you! I am going back to bed. I don't wanna hear another peep out of here for an hour. Go to sleep. Mom slams the door behind her.        Samantha is suddenl almost cheerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Samantha) Faker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason swings on a large outdoor swing, while Tommy sits thumbing through a catalog. Immediately after, we see Mas and Tommy looking through the lingerie section of the cat together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Ohh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing, giggling) Look what I found in the street!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, right? (turns page) Look at those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm, look at those!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggling) Ohh!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later we see Mason having an introspective moment he gazes upon a deceased bird's carcass in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, Samantha, and Mason eat lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So listen, guys, I wanna talk to you about something, and you might not like this idea at first but... we're moving to Houston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, soon. We should be out by the first, so we don't have to pay two rents next month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mother, we're not moving. Nope, nope, sorry Mom. Nope. Nope. Smack, smack, smack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha, I have to go back to college so I can make us a better living. Smack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this job I can't take care of us the way I'd like to. I can't keep going this way. And Grandma said she'd help us out... and it would be nice to be near her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, Mother. You can do whatever you want but (shrugs) We're not moving. (Smacks) Mason moves his fork around in his bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about our friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, baby, we can e-mail them or write. We can come back to visit. And guess what? She reaches out to touch Samantha's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place that Grandma found us, you'll each have your own room. Right? Samantha shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's a pool. Samantha shrugs again, clearly not sold on the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason and Mom are lying on his bed together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, do you still love Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still love your father... but that doesn't mean it was healthy for us to stay together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if after we move he's trying to find us and he can't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that won't be a problem. He can call Grandma and she'll tell him or he can call Information. We won't be hard to find. She pushes back his hair lovingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he still in Alaska?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's what your uncle says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably taming polar bears or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... well, I hope they're taming him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moving van drives off as mom puts another item in the pile of stuff to be left at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom and Mason are getting ready to paint in the empty bed They're looking at the two lone murals, which look a litt odd without the bunk bed in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, wanna help me out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Take this paint... very carefully... and paint any little smudge or mark or anything on the baseboard there, behind the door, and all around the doorways on the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Samantha is talking on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) She says we're gonna come visit and I'm gonna write and call you. Oh, wait, hold on a second. I'm getting another call. (Pushes Flash) Hello? Sorry, Tommy, Mason can't come over today. We're moving. And I'm on the other line. Bye. (Pushes Button) Althea? I'm gonna be sending Sailor Scout instructions. Email, and write back telling me how the other scouts are doing. Well, because you're the leader now. During the last bit of this conversation, Mason slowly pa over the "growth chart" lines on the bedroom door jamb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying their final belongings from inside the house, th slowly exit the front door and head over to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's go, 'cause I wanna get there before it gets dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye yard, goodbye crepe myrtle, goodbye mailbox. Goodbye box of stuff Mommy won't let us take with us but we don't wanna throw away. Goodbye house, I'll never like mommy as much for making us move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha! Why don't you say goodbye to that little horse shit attitude? Okay? 'Cause we're not taking that in the car. Just before he gets in the car, Mason is looking out at t neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye old lady who listens to rock music and rides a motorcycle. Soon the car is pulling away. As they drive off, Mason notices out his side of the car, Tommy approaching on a b in the distance, gesturing toward the car. Mason watches him out the window, but says nothing as Tommy recedes int the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason and Samantha are restless     and energetic, lettin childish energy get the best of     them as they wrestle, and squeal at each other in the     back seat of the car. all well-intentioned though, as     the two share a laugh Mom tells them to quiet down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eeeee!   Don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey, what's happening back there? Stop, put the barrier up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh!   Stop!    No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason punches the pillow barrier between himself and Sama while his Mom speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, put the pillow between you. Make a barrier, come on. Stop. We're gonna play a game called The Game of Silence. Whoever can stay quiet for the longest period of time wins. You guys think you can do that? Okay, go! The family's car moves on toward the Houston skyline just dusk arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason appears grumpy, trying to shove what he needs for t day into his backpack quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus'll be here in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steps into doorway) Put that homework in your backpack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go eat!    Baby, go eat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha places pancakes on their plates while talking to Mason in a cryptic language, reminiscent of pig latin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I affatay servay yoohay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak English! Shut up. Mom! She's speaking that stupid language again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was speaking perfectly clear English, Mother. You know, he's a little slow in the head. He did officially flunk first grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit your butt down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, Mother sir! She salutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, listen up guys. Grandma's gonna pick you up after school. Your dad is in town for the day so you're gonna spend the afternoon with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he moving back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't seen him in about eighty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like... a year and a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to Samantha) Ha-ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we please eat, here? The bus is coming. Who wants syrup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason plays Oregon Trail on a classroom computer, while h TEACHER speaks in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, nice cursive. Okay, Mason, when I check the mobiles, am I gonna find yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I didn't finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's time to finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, let's do Apple Quit. Mason cuts a sheet of construction paper in the shape of state of Texas, presumably to finish his mobile. He sits across from a female classmate, GIRL IN RED, who teases h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to finish your work, Mason. "Apple Quit."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha sits with her GRANDMA, Catherine, showing off he good grades on various school reports. Mason sits in his own chair, playing with a Gameboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is my history test...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hm.   A+, very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's another history test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hm, and another A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, it doesn't have a plus but... oh well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Grandma strokes Samantha's hair proudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then um, that's my report on lizards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, let me see your pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, um... Oh yeah, these are my pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's called a dewlap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dewlap, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, this is a math test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, "A" again. Mason reaches into candy dish on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mase, that's the last candy, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.    We need to put this stuff up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Pontiac GTO pulls up outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him. DAD gets out of the car and hurries to the door.    Saman squeals, as she runs out to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!    Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my!    Look at you, you're so big! He hugs them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, MJ! What's happening, buddy? Are you guys ready to have some fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Alright.     Hey, Catherine, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mase.    I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time should I have these rascals back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know, around 7:30, I guess. I gotta get 'em home by 8:00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, you know what, why don't I take them over to their mom's? A moment of tension passes between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's okay. She's expecting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, that's alright. You guys know where it is, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm.   Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll do it.     It's no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's such a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's no problem.     Alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolls her eyes) Okay...

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You guys ready to go?

dialogues.speaker: MASON AND SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Let's do it, go!

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Whoa. Wait a minute, you gotta get your stuff.

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: You got backpacks, your purse. Homework. Go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Can't believe how big they are.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: Yeah.    Time is goin' by.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Mm. Must be nice for you, having 'em here in Houston.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: I love it, yeah. I'm volunteering at their school.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?   What you doin' over there?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: I'm in the library.         You know, reading to the little ones.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Huh.    Great.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: So -- Alaska, huh?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: Are you back?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: We'll see.   How's Liv?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: She's a busy girl. Yeah. She's back in school. But she's working, and single parenting... a lot to juggle.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You guys got everything, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MASON AND SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Alright, say goodbye to your grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Bye!

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Bye grandma!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Alright, let's roll. Now wait a second. You're not the type of kids who like presents, are ya?

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Naw, you don't --

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: 'Course we are!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Really?   Let's do it!

dialogues.speaker: MASON AND SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: Yeah!   Yay!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I call front seat!

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: I wanted the front seat, though.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Alright. Well, Mason gets it on the way there and Samantha gets it on the way back, huh? Hop in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seat belts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seat belts.     Alright. He motions to Grandma that he's got it covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seat belts. Not like this car has any seat belts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha is bowling, her pink ball hurdling down the lane toward the pins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice...   Nice... Nice... Strike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!    Alright! Dad is clearly impressed and excited for Samantha, as he stands to embrace her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, come here, yes! That was awesome! Get up there Mason, get up there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Samantha) It was so good! (to Mason) Come on. Let 'em know who you are, buddy. Let 'em know who you are. Dad kisses Samantha.      Mason throws his bowling ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!    Yes!   Yes! Alright, alright... Gutter ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish we could use the bumpers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumpers are for kids. You know, what're you, two years old? You don't want the bumpers. Life doesn't give you bumpers. Mason tosses the ball again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we, there we go, there we go! We got something there! We got something! We got something! Ooooh! Another gutter ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time I went bowling we had bumpers and it was a lot more fun! Dad gets up to bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want the bumpers, alright? You bowl a strike with the bumpers and it doesn't mean anything. Trust me. Just lay it out on the lane. One, two, three and... Samantha mimes smoking, points to Dad, as if to say that smells of cigarettes. It's Dad's turn to bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ka-blam! Let's hear it for the father! Whoo! (To Samantha) Get up there, get in there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yay!   Great job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out there, girl, get out there! Score-keeping screen flashes an animated alligator that r

dialogues.speaker: STRIKE
dialogues.text: EXT. Street as car burns (on TV screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four Blackwater operatives have been viciously attacked in their cars in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallujah. The bodies and cars were set on fire, after insurgents started shooting, killing American citizens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. It's a disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the ambush didn't end there. The bodies of the four men were savagely ripped apart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family sits around a table enjoying their snacks, whi Dad smokes a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let me tell you what's happening in Iraq, alright? Exactly what every thinking person in the world knew was gonna happen before they got started. Bush and his little numb-nut fanatics he's got around him, they don't give a rat's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a quarter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a quarter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said a-s-s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry.   My bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my teacher says it's a good war, because it's better to be safe than sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they're teaching you in school? Alright, listen to me. Listen to your father, okay? That is the lie. That's the big lie. Iraq had nothing to do with what happened at the World Trade Center. You know that, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Alright. Who are you gonna vote for next fall, MJ?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: He can't vote. He's not eighteen.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Yeah, oh -- alright, who would you vote for?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Kerry?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Anybody but Bush!   Okay?

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: Are you gonna move back?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Uh... I'm plannin' on it.   You know, I gotta find a job.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Are you and mom gonna get back together?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I don't know. That's not, uh... entirely up to me, you know?

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: I remember when I was six, you and mom were fighting like mad. You were yelling so loud and she was crying.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: That's what you remember, huh?

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You don't remember the trips to Galveston, camping in Big Bend, all the fun we had?

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever get mad at your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever get mad at your brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    You ever yell at him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Doesn't mean you don't love him, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the same thing happens when you're grown up, alright? You... You know, you get mad at people. You know, it's not a big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do in Alaska?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked on a boat for a while.     Um, I tried to write some music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see any polar bears?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I saw a Kodiak bear.     It was fuckin' huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! That's fifty cents for the F- word! Dad reaches into his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Here, take a dollar, alright? Keep the change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are gonna be seein' a lot more of me. Okay? I missed you two real bad, while I was gone. Okay, I want you to know that. I just needed to take some time. You know, to... Just... Your mom and me, okay... Well, your mother, okay, is a piece of work. Alright, I think, I think you know that by now. Alright? And I'm just, I'm so happy to be with the two of you. Okay. And I'm sorry about that bumper business. Alright. I'm gonna get better at stuff like that, okay? As a token of reconciliation, Dad high fives them both, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason shows Dad his collection of arrowheads and a long feather, all laid out on top of a skateboard. Mason descr each of the pieces to his Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got that one at Dripping Springs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmhmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And um, my friend Rodney gave me that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I bought that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bought this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found this at Dripping Springs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!    What else do you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, um, these are snake vertebrae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snake vertebrae? That's disgusting. Huh? Mason, I don't want you collecting snake vertebrae anymore. They both share a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the feather I sent you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!    Yeah, yeah, yeah, it is. Samantha enters the room carrying photos and a stuffed an She sits down next to Dad, interrupting Mason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Dad! Um, I forgot to show you these, um, these basketball pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on a basketball team?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!    Check you out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and these are-- these are beaver claws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beaver claws?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.    That's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you hunting beaver, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, that's McKinney, that's Meg, and that Gem. They're all my friends --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And this is dried Canadian grass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.   What position do you play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is dried Canadian grass... And, and uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.   Wait, you scoring any points?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, about eight or ten a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight or ten a game?     That is awesome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once she didn't score any and she cried!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cried?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, only a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awww. Dad kisses Samantha's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mason, Mom's home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom's home! Dad quickly shifts from playful to nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mom's home.

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: Mom, hi!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: Oh, look at this owl Daddy gave me! Isn't it cool? See, its head spins! And look at this bracelet! It was made by Indians in Alaska.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: And Mom, Daddy made this cool hand carved grizzly bear and this tiki.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: It's a totem. Wow.

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: And guess what else? We went bowling and I made four strikes!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah, and we got to ride around in Dad's car!

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Hey, Liv.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I know you wanted me to drop them off at your mom's. I just thought it'd be easier if I brought 'em over here.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Well, it really screwed up my plans.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Well, we just wanted to show him our rooms.

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Did you guys eat anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we had some french fries at the bowling alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you do your homework or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Can I talk to you outside for a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure. (as he exits) They had more than french fries. The children scramble to find a suitable spot for eavesdropping but their parents are inaudible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha and Mason look out the window, down at their par having an argument below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he's gonna spend the night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look like it. Mom walks away from Dad. He stands there for a beat, then saunters off. The kids are visibly disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason and Mom walk across the campus lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A professor, BILL, lectures to the class.     Mason and M seated in the classroom audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. An unconditioned stimulus, something that produces an unlearned, involuntary, unconditioned response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now in Pavlov's experiment, what was the stimulus, that he used? Come on now, people! Tough weekend? What's the deal, here? Meat. Right? Meat. Meat powder, actually. Whatever meat powder is, it worked on this dog. Okay. He put the meat powder in there and it produced an unconditioned response in the dog, which was? Salivation. Alright. Now, who can give me another example of an unconditioned stimulus-response pair that happens to you everyday. It's probably happening to some of you right now. (pause) How about sex? Sure, you know. You see an attractive member of the opposite gender, you have an automatic response. You don't have to think about it. Mick Jagger wrote a song about... Oh, when they call your name, I salivate like a Pavlov dog. Class laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much. Class dismissed. Students leave, as Mason and Mom approach the professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Welbrock, this is my son Mason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason, this is Dr. Welbrock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son. Now see, I thought this was a boy genius who was taking my college course. Mason laughs.    He and Bill shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't feeling well today, so I thought I'd bring him with me. Bill touches Mason's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! No fever. It's a con job. I can tell because I have a nine year old son, he pulls this all the time. Same kind of deal. Hey, you play soccer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither does my boy. He hates soccer. He likes computers. My 11-year-old daughter, loves soccer. Who can figure? Hey, maybe we can get all you guys together sometime, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe, yeah.     Well, you ready to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Mason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And thanks for coming to my class. Mason walks ahead of them as Olivia and Bill speak a litt more intimately. It's clear that they have more than just professor-student relationship. Mason notices a bit of th and looks on, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you think, uh, Grandma might be available for a little baby-sitting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggles) Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   Well, great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason and Samantha play an outdoor trampoline game with R and Mindy, their new stepbrother and stepsister. They are in the big backyard of their new home, where Dr. Welbrock and his children have lived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey kids, they're here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, they're home, they're home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry!    Hurry! They all scramble inside and quickly assemble for a big welcome home ceremony in the front entryway. A sign reads "Welcome Home Honeymooners, We Love You Mom & Dad". O and Bill open the door to enter the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!   Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!    We're here!     Hey, we've returned! Hugs all around. The family talks over one another. notices the "Welcome Home" sign the kids made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha, Mason, look -- Thank you. That's very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Randy and Mindy) Hey guys! The group all speaks at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Grandma) Hi, Mom. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, Mom, Mom, Mom! Look at the sign we made!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Grandma) They give you any trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha and I made it all ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the boys helped you with that a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not at all! The group continues to speak at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good... Oh, pass out the goodies. Mom passes out a bag of presents to each of the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for the girls, this is for the girls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Grandma) Don't worry, we got you some absinthe or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, let's pour it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family sits around the table, swapping fun stories an pictures from their time apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take this big elevator up, and when we got to the top, we flew a paper airplane off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It flew!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It flew away. It went for miles. Went onto the Arctic Trail. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, did you guys kiss under the Bridge of Sighs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we did. Bill leans in to kiss Olivia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mom, can we see your wedding ring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure. Mom hands over her wedding ring. The boys look at a 20 Questions game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Eyeing the ring) Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Holding the ring) Technically that's a fancy step cut surrounded by miniature brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish we could've gone to Europe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we'll go as a family next time. But you didn't miss much, really. We just stayed in the hotel room the whole time playing video games. Mom laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the hotels are really small and really old. Squeaky. The WAITER comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you anything else? Would you like to see a dessert menu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Randy) Listen, I told you to put that away. (To Mom) Would you put that in your purse, please? Computer games at the table. (To Waiter) Yes, uh, please, another bottle of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Waiter) Um, Coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, you know what? Mason, you're okay with water. No more Cokes. (to Waiter) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Randy) Now how 'bout you? Did you finish your science project?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, did you work on it? I mean, did you build anything, or plan anything, or..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mindy) Did he work on it at all, Mindy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mindy) Did he sit around playing video games with Mason the whole time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm. You were supposed to finish that by the time I got back. Remember? Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our gang of kids, plus two more (NEIGHBORHOOD BOY and NEIGHBORHOOD GIRL) walk home from school together. The bo walk in a pack slightly in front of the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grievous is the best, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoda!   Yoda, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Yoda is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has four arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoda!   Represent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate Ms. Billingsly. Everybody's been saying she's lesbian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is.   She hit on Stacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, that's gross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think it's true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's always walking in the locker room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I still have a couple of those-- PAUL, overly large/mentally impaired neighborhood teen th seem familiar with, walks by awkwardly bouncing a basketb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Paul.     Tell us a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.   Fuck.     Go to hell.   Ass. The kids look at him quizzically and keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason and Randy are playing a video game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh!    Blew you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw heck, man. That was not fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, actually it was. That's like the fairest thing ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, once again I take you down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha and Mindy sit with Mom on the sofa, laughing, wh Mason and Randy sit opposite them. Bill is up first, as t whole family plays charades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three Musketeers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicken?     Bird? Mom and the girls laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... hood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big hair?     Uh. Robin Hood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tapping his nose) Ah! Mom applauds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brilliant child! Samantha stands to take her turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blanket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you can't use props! Samantha turns to smack mason with the blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey, hey. Cut it out. Hey, uh-- Judges speak: No props. No props. Can't use props. You can do it without that. Think, think, think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, bunch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folding?    Is it like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gathered? Folded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... The boys laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Messing around with a blanket... Wrinkling it, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrinkling clothes... A Wrinkle In Time! Mom and Mindy clap and cheer at their victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign reads: "7-15: Harry Potter and the Half-blood Prince Magical Midnight Release Party 9PM." The kids are all pre dressed in Harry Potter costumes. They participate in a variety of Harry Potter festivities, beginning with a tri contest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the guards at Azkaban? Samantha rings the bell first, as Mason fumbles for the correct answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dementors! Samantha got it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into a microphone) Front of the line, are you ready? All four kids cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count down with me, ladies and gentleman! The rest of the crowd joins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten! Nine! Eight! Seven! Six! Five! Four! Three! Two! One!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!    Whoo!! The kids each pass through the long line, all smiles as t receive their books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: Mason, Randy, and Bill are practicing at a golf course. Bill is advising the boys on their stances and golf swing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Randy) Oh no, no, no, no. Back up and take a practice swing first, remember? Nice and easy. Sweep the floor. Sweep the floor. That's good. Don't swing too hard, Randy. (to Mason) He always swings too hard. Randy takes a swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, alright! Very good. It's Mason's turn to take a swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mason) Back your feet up a little bit. Yeah, like that. Now you're gonna hit it straighter. Okay. Alright, go up and hit it. That's good. Nice slow swing is going to be better for you. Mason swings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright! Later, Randy putts the ball and misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Randy) I don't know man, you must've been... See, your feet are too open, Randy. Mason sets up to take his putt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mason) Nice and natural. Mason hits the ball into the hole.       Bill high fives

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Go! Alright! Give me five. Good putt, son, good putt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that, Randy? That's the way to do it! (to self) Alright, birdie putt. Bill misses the easy putt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it. Son of a bitch. (to Mason and Randy) Get my clubs, would you? Get the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and the boys drive up to the local liquor store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just in case we have guests this weekend. Bill gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
